crazing: 1. A photo of a ceramic vase showing a network of fine surface cracks, resembling intricate spiderweb patterns, caused by thermal stress.
patches: 4. A photo of a close-up view of steel, highlighting areas with irregular, shadowy patches that have a blurred transition into the rest of the material.
pitted_surface: 4. A photo of an ancient architectural metal piece, its surface dotted with multiple tiny craters, showing the characteristic markings of prolonged corrosion.
rolled-in_scale: 1. A photo of a close-up view of a steel sheet surface showing parallel, linear scale marks that appear to be pressed into the metal, indicative of the hot rolling process.
scratches: 5. A photo of a polished wooden floor with several long, narrow scratches, where the top layer of varnish has been removed, creating a distinct contrast with the surrounding smooth surface.
inclusion: 3. A photo of a polished steel sample under magnification, revealing tiny, scattered dark spots embedded in the metal, characteristic of non-metallic inclusions.
